title: Public preview: New General-Purpose VMs - Dlsv5 and Dldsv5
summary: The Dlsv5 and Dldsv5 VM series provide 2GiBs per vCPU and can offer lower price points within the general-purpose Azure Virtual Machines portfolio.

title: Public preview: Serverless Hyperscale in Azure SQL Database
summary: Automatically scale compute based on workload demand using serverless for Hyperscale in Azure SQL Database.

title: Generally Available: Azure Functions Linux Elastic Premium plan increased maximum scale-out limits
summary: Maximum scale-out limits for Functions Linux Premium plans have been increased in several regions.

title: Generally Available: Availability zones support for Azure Functions in new regions
summary: You can now use Availability Zones with Azure Functions in Norway East, South Africa North, Switzerland North, and UAE North.

title: Generally Available: Durable Functions support for .NET isolated model
summary: Durable Functions support for .NET 7.0 running in the isolated worker process is now generally available.

title: Public preview: Major version upgrade in Azure Database for PostgreSQL – Flexible Server
summary: Eliminate the need to set up new servers and complete manual upgrades with in-place major version upgrade for Azure Database for PostgreSQL – Flexible Server.

title: General availability: Encryption using CMK for Azure Database for PostgreSQL – Flexible Server
summary: Use infrastructure encryption to add an additional layer of encryption for data at rest using customer-managed keys.

title: Public preview: VBS enclaves for Always Encrypted in Azure SQL Database
summary: VBS enclaves enable you with the flexibility to use Always Encrypted with secure enclaves in all Azure SQL Database offerings.

title: Public preview: Cluster key index in Azure Cosmos DB for Apache Cassandra
summary: Improve application performance by creating indexes on your cluster key index and run faster queries in Azure Cosmos DB for Apache Cassandra.

title: Azure SQL—General availability updates for mid-February 2023
summary: General availability enhancements and updates released for Azure SQL in mid-February 20223

title: General availability: Azure Active Directory for Azure Database for PostgreSQL – Flexible Server
summary: Use Azure Active Directory-based authentication methods using Azure Active Directory principals, managed identities, and groups to connect and access Azure Database for PostgreSQL - Flexible Server.

title: General availability: Improved geo-replication for Azure Cache for Redis
summary: Utilize new functionality that makes passive geo-replication more seamless and transparent.

title: Public Preview: SDK type bindings
summary: Azure Functions .NET isolated worker now supports blob triggers and input bindings.

title: Generally available: Azure Functions support for Python 3.10
summary: You can now develop Python 3.10 apps locally and deploy them to all Azure Functions plans.

title: Public preview: Upgrade scheduler
summary: Use the upgrade scheduler feature instead of the planned maintenance feature for more flexibility.

title: General availability: Automatic Backup for App Service Environment and Azure Functions Dedicated Hosting
summary: General availability: Automatic Backup for App Service Environment and Azure Functions Dedicated Hosting

title: Generally available: New storage backend for Durable Functions — Microsoft Netherite & MSSQL
summary: You can now use storage providers other than Azure Storage for Durable Functions.

title: Generally Available: Azure Kubernetes Service introduces two pricing tiers: Free and Standard
summary: Identify and use the most appropriate AKS tier for your projects.

title: General availability: Trusted launch for Azure VMs in Azure for US Government regions
summary: Allows you to enable secure boot, vTPM, virtualization-based security, and Microsoft Defender for Cloud integration, providing additional layers of defense against sophisticated threats.

title: Azure SQL Gen 4 hardware approaching end of life 31 March 2023
summary: Intel E5-2673 (Haswell) v3-based CPUs used in Gen 4 hardware will no longer be supported after 31 March 2023.  Transition to newer compute hardware for your Azure SQL databases and instances.
